meanings.definition: To reduce the size or scale of something.
meanings.sent1: The company downscaled its operations to save money.
meanings.sent2: The architect downscaled the building plans to fit the budget.
meanings.sent3: The chef downscaled the recipe, but it still tasted delicious.
meanings.sent4: She downscaled her wardrobe, keeping only the essentials.
meanings.sent5: The teacher downscaled the assignment to make it more manageable for the students.

meanings.definition: Made smaller in size or scale.
meanings.sent1: The downscaled model of the car was more affordable.
meanings.sent2: The downscaled version of the painting fit perfectly in the living room.
meanings.sent3: The downscaled toy was a big hit with the children.
meanings.sent4: Her downscaled jewelry collection was elegant and understated.
meanings.sent5: The downscaled font made the text easier to read on the screen.
